examples: her work is infused with an anger born of pain and oppression

verb.description: Soak (tea, herbs, etc.) in liquid to extract the flavor or healing properties.
examples: infuse the dried flowers in boiling water

verb.description: Allow (a liquid) to flow into a patient, vein, etc.
examples: saline was infused into the aorta

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin infus- poured in, from the verb infundere, from in- into + fundere pour.
